intro: Dupineta loandensis, commonly known as the Loandé sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its succulent leaves are adapted to store water, allowing it to thrive in dry conditions. Dupineta loandensis is often found in sandy or rocky soils, making it a typical component of desert ecosystems.
